Agency: Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration

Description: EPA and the U.S. Department of Justice lodged in U.S. District Court for the Northern District of Alabama a proposed modification of a prior 2006 consent decree with Alabama Power Company that will secure further reductions of harmful air pollutants, primarily sulfur dioxide (SO2) and nitrogen oxide (NOx), from three of the companys coal-fired power plants in Alabama.

Agency: Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration

Description: Nicor, Inc., a major Chicago-area natural gas distributor, agreed to pay approximately $10 million to settle allegations that it engaged in improper transactions, made material misrepresentations, and failed to disclose material information regarding Nicor's gas inventory in order to meet earnings targets and increase the company's revenues under a performance-based rate plan administered by the Illinois Commerce Commission.

Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Atlanta Gas Light Company and utility locator company STS, Inc. paid a total of $30,000 to resolve issues stemming from the April 8, 2008 natural gas leak in Marietta, Georgia.
The Georgia Public Service Commission approved a settlement with Atlanta Gas Light Company concerning an accident and voted to split the money between two non-profit organizations.

The Georgia Public Service Commission unanimously approved a $250,000 civil penalty against the Atlanta Gas Light Company (AGLC) that will settle issues surrounding the construction and deployment of the Eastside Pipeline while protecting ratepayers from future costs involving deficiencies in the Eastside Pipeline.
